pr_title: [#1252] Expose token replay info in EventTrackerStatus

timeline.message: expose token replay info in EventTrackerStatus

timeline.bodyText: Nit: To be more in line with the getReplayPosition method name, I'd call this method the getResetPosition.
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: Nit: I think using 1 second i.o. 5 for the getResetTokenPosition validation is sufficient.
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: Nit: I think using 1 second i.o. 5 for the getResetTokenPosition validation is sufficient.
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't both getReplayPosition and getResetTokenPosition return false it this point, as isReplaying is false too?
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * In case no estimation can be given or no replay an {@code OptionalLong.empty()} will be returned.
          
          
            
                 * In case no estimation can be given or no replay is active, an {@code OptionalLong.empty()} will be returned.

+     * In case no estimation can be given or no replay an {@code OptionalLong.empty()} will be returned.

timeline.bodyText: I'd adjust this javadoc somewhat similar to the suggested adjustments in the EventTrackerStatus interface.
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: I think this method should check whether this.trackingToken is an instance of ReplayToken. Otherwise, I wouldn't expect a position.
timeline.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: Can be useful to have here a method that returns the estimated number of events remaining to process.

replies.bodyText:
Good point.
This will be part of a future issue.
replies.author: corradom

replies.bodyText:
I would prefer to expose 2 (or ultimately 3) positions:

current position
reset position (if still replaying)
(and later) the position of the head of the stream

Components that then monitor the state of the processor can then calculate the estimated time for catching up with the reset position and/or head. From the framework, I prefer to emit the simple facts, and let observing components do the "magic" math ;-)
replies.author: abuijze

replies.bodyText: Sweet plan. That'll leave the getResetPosition as is, but will replace the getReplayPosition() method for a regular getPosition.
replies.author: smcvb

timeline.bodyText: is it really useful? getTrackingToken().getPosition() and is Replaying() together can give the same information I think, is it correct?

replies.bodyText: The idea behind the ticket is to promote and get a much more clear way to access already existing information.
replies.author: corradom

replies.bodyText: I agree, it seems that currentPosition and reset(Token)Position should be enough
replies.author: abuijze
